9e70aedf.name: ValorStone CH3 System
9e70aedf.note: The full database structure used for everything stored in the new system.

d3183855.name: id
d3183855.note: The ID that will be used elsewhere to reference the Character

bd98fae3.name: Guide
bd98fae3.content:
# A guide to use this system

So this document system is all you would want.

## Databases

- Create: Workspace → New Database
- Tables: + Table; Rename / Note / Delete from row actions
- Columns: + Column; set Name, Type, PK, Null, Default, Reference (FK). Hover icons for hints
- ER Diagram:
    - Pan/Zoom: drag background / mouse wheel
    - Move: drag tables
    - Auto layout / Fit: top-right buttons
    - Edges: directional and labeled (from_table.col → to_table.col)

## Docs

- Create: Docs → New Folder / New Document
- Organize: Expand/Collapse folders; Move/Rename/Delete via row actions
- Edit vs Read:
    - Edit: simple editor, Tab = 4 spaces, Ctrl+S saves (auto-save after typing)
    - Read: compact view with line numbers on hover
- Notes:
    - Badges show count (always visible)
    - Hover line number: quick preview
    - Click badge: all notes modal
    - Click line: add note (modal)
- Linking:
    - Press $ while editing to insert links to docs/headings or DB entities (db/table/column)
- Sharing:
    - Share read-only links for docs or folders
- Status:
    - “Saved” shows briefly on save; “Last updated” appears on docs

## References

- Using the dollar character in chat will popup a modal where you can select and search for things to refer to.
- It includes: Databases, tables, columns, Documents, headings in documents.
- If you enter edit mode, you can see how it looks in edit, but it won't tell you much.
- Few examples:
    - [Document in folder 1]([[doc:c0d78e1c]]) - a file even in folder.
    - [Deeper Doc]([[doc:d9694092#deeper-doc]]) - a heading reference!
    - [ValorStone CH3 System]([[db:9e70aedf:valorstone-ch3-system]]) - Reference a whole database!
    - [id]([[col:9e70aedf:5be7d9bb:d3183855:person.id]]) - or even an item in a database.
- People with shared link that does not cover referenced files cannot access them, so don't worry.
- You can try yourself in here or in [Try it out!]([[doc:bb512d96]])
